paragraph.paragraph: The Eiffel Libraries folder (../../../../images/icons/eiffel_libraries.ico) is one of the four top-level EiffelEnvision ../project.xmlProject folders. It's purpose is solely to reference other Eiffel library clusters that reside outside of a project. Recommended: Although adding clusters or subclusters, located somewhere under a project's location, under the Eiffel Libraries folder is permitted, it is not recommended. Having project specific and non-project specific items mixed under the Eiffel Libraries folder may cause later confusion. See the ../project.xmlclean_separationClean Separation section of this documentation for more information.

Eiffel Libraries can only contain ../project_items/clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folders and may be added through the context_menu.xmlcontext menu. For more information on adding clusters, see ../../configuring/adding_items/adding_clusters.xmlAdding New Clusters.

Clusters that reside under the Eiffel Libraries folder will only contain ../project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_enumeration.xmlautomatically enumerated Eiffel source files and will not permit the adding of other type of files. This is because only Eiffel source libraries should be reference here and not project specific items, or items that do not constitute a source code file. If there is a need to add non-project specific items to your EiffelEnvision project then they may be added in under the ../other_project_items/index.xmlOther Project Items folder.
